wikitext.*:
'''Daphne R. Castell''' ([[1929]]<ref name=FJ>{{webcite|author=[[Colin Duriez]]|articleurl=http://www.festivalintheshire.com/journal1bdx/castell.html|articlename=Daphne Castell: An early fan who had a momentous interview with J.R.R. Tolkien|dated=|website=[http://www.festivalintheshire.com/journal1bdx/index.html ''Festival in the Shire Journal'', Issue 1]|accessed=7 May 2012}}</ref> - [[3 August]] [[1983]]<ref>{{webcite|author=|articleurl=http://www.isfdb.org/cgi-bin/ea.cgi?11442|articlename=Daphne Castell - Summary Bibliography|dated=|website=[http://www.isfdb.org/cgi-bin/index.cgi The Internet Speculative Fiction Database]|accessed=7 May 2012}}</ref>) was a British science-fiction writer and librarian. During the 1950s at Oxford University, [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] supervised her thesis about Thomas Chatterton, which was never completed.<ref name=FJ/><ref name=CGC/> She married Malcolm Cloke in 1955.<ref name=FJ/>

In late spring or early summer 1966, Castell conducted an [[Index:Interviews with J.R.R. Tolkien|interview with Tolkien]] for the magazine ''New Worlds''.<ref name=CGC>{{CG|C}}, pp. 369, 372, 373, 440, 666, 801</ref>

**"Tolkien on Tolkien: Making of a Myth"

**"The Realms of Tolkien"
